intro: Cynoglossum campanulatum, commonly known as the bellflower of the genus Cynoglossum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
